alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 19 at 3:08PM HST until December 19 at 6:15PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: The National Weather Service in Honolulu has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The island of Hawaii in Hawaii County * Until 615 PM HST. * At 308 PM HST, radar indicated heavy rain over the slopes of the Kohala Mountains. The highest rain rates of 2 to 3 inches per hour were falling on saturated ground over Hawi, the Akoni Pule Highway, and the Kohala Mountain Road. The heavy rainfall is spreading southeastward toward Kawaihae. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Waikoloa Village, Kapaau, Kawaihae, Kohala Ranch, Puako, Kamuela, Pololu Valley, Waimanu Valley, Waipio Valley, Halaula, Hawi, Kukuihaele, Mauna Lani, Waikoloa Beach, Waikii and Mahukona. This warning may need to be extended beyond 615 PM HST if flooding persists. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown.
